question: 準備
sourceMnemonic:
When you follow <kanji>standard</kanji> procedure to <kanji>provide</kanji> what's needed, you make the perfect <vocabulary>preparation</vocabulary>!

Both <ja>準備</ja> and <ja>用意</ja> mean "preparation," but <ja>準備</ja> means preparing in advance for an event, whereas <ja>用意</ja> implies taking appropriate measures. So, <ja>準備</ja> is better for planning a party, while <ja>用意</ja> fits well when making sure you have enough snacks for your guests.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
